title: Terms of Service
introduction: These Terms of Service ("Terms") govern the use of products and services provided by Expanse Hosting, operated by Cosmorack LTD ("Expanse," "we," "our," "us"). By creating an account, purchasing a service, or accessing any Expanse platform, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and agree to be legally bound by these Terms, together with our Service Level Agreement (SLA), Privacy Policy, and Acceptable Use Policy (AUP). If you do not agree, you must immediately discontinue use of our services.

sections.title: Introduction & Acceptance of Terms
sections.content: 1.1 These Terms apply to all users of Expanse services. 1.2 By accessing or using Expanse services, you agree to be bound by these Terms, as well as our SLA, Privacy Policy, and AUP. 1.3 Continued use of Expanse services constitutes acceptance of these Terms.

subsections.subtitle: 2.1 Minimum Age
subsections.text: You must be at least 13 years old to use Expanse services.

subsections.subtitle: 2.2 Contractual Capacity
subsections.text: You must be 18 years of age or older to enter into binding agreements, purchase paid services, or manage billing. Users aged 13–17 may use services with the explicit consent of a parent or legal guardian. Expanse may request evidence of consent but does not routinely verify it.

sections.title: Account Responsibilities
sections.content: 4.1 You agree to: (a) provide accurate registration and billing details; (b) maintain the security and confidentiality of your credentials; (c) ensure all activity under your account complies with the AUP and these Terms; and (d) use the services only for lawful purposes. 4.2 You are fully responsible for all actions performed through your account or using your services.

subsections.subtitle: 5.1 Billing
subsections.text: Services are billed in advance for the selected billing cycle. Failure to pay may result in suspension or termination after a seven (7) day grace period. Subscriptions auto‑renew unless cancelled in the client area prior to renewal.

subsections.subtitle: 5.2 Refund Policy
subsections.text: Minecraft Hosting & Web Hosting: Full refund within forty‑eight (48) hours of initial purchase (no questions asked). Between forty‑eight (48) hours and seven (7) days, refunds may be issued as store credit only, prorated, and at Expanse’s sole discretion. VPS & Dedicated/Bare Metal: No refunds under any circumstances. General refund conditions: no refunds for abuse‑related suspensions, AUP/Terms violations, prepaid or bulk billing cycles, add‑ons, domains, or software licenses, or for cancellations after seven (7) days.

subsections.subtitle: 5.3 Chargebacks
subsections.text: Any chargeback or payment dispute will result in immediate account termination, irreversible data loss, and possible permanent ban. Expanse reserves the right to pursue legal remedies for fraudulent disputes.

subsections.subtitle: 6.1 Customer Responsibility
subsections.text: You are responsible for all data stored on your service, maintaining backups, securing your applications, and preventing unauthorized access.

subsections.subtitle: 6.2 Expanse Liability
subsections.text: Expanse does not guarantee data retention and is not liable for data loss caused by hardware failure, software corruption, OS reinstalls, node crashes, human error, suspension or termination, or force majeure events.

subsections.subtitle: 6.3 Backup Policy
subsections.text: Any backups provided by Expanse are best‑effort only and are not guaranteed to be error‑free, complete, or current.

subsections.subtitle: 6.4 Data on Terminated Services
subsections.text: Data may be permanently deleted at any time following suspension or termination and cannot be recovered.

sections.title: Acceptable Use & Prohibited Activities
sections.content: 7.1 Use of Expanse services must comply with the Acceptable Use Policy (AUP). 7.2 The following activities are strictly prohibited and may result in immediate suspension or termination:
list: Malware, botnets, or malicious scripts
Spam, bulk email, or SMTP abuse
Unauthorized scanning, brute forcing, or penetration testing
Cryptocurrency mining
TOR relays or anonymization networks
Flooding, DDoS, stress testing, or attack tools
Illegal content (including CSAM, terrorism-related content, hate material)
High-risk workloads (e.g., stressors, stresser panels, flooders)
Using Minecraft proxies to access external servers to exploit DDoS protection
Mass scanning, scraping, or network abuse
Actions generating upstream provider complaints

subsections.subtitle: 7.3 Resource Abuse
subsections.text: Expanse may throttle or limit CPU/Network usage to protect infrastructure. Customers are responsible for all actions originating from their services.

subsections.subtitle: 8.1 Immediate Suspension Triggers
subsections.text: Expanse may suspend or null-route without notice for: malware or botnets; DDoS origination; verified abuse complaints; illegal content; brute force or scanning attempts; crypto mining; TOR relays; or actions threatening our infrastructure or other customers.

subsections.subtitle: 8.2 24-Hour Response Cases
subsections.text: For issues such as spam or SMTP abuse, the customer will be notified and must respond within twenty‑four (24) hours, failing which suspension may occur.

subsections.subtitle: 8.3 Null Routing
subsections.text: Expanse may null-route IP addresses if an attack materially impacts other customers or upstream networks.

subsections.subtitle: 9.1 Filing a Complaint

list: Game hosting performance may vary based on shared resources.
You must avoid using malicious files/plugins.

sections.title: Support Limitations
sections.content: Support covers general server and network issues. VPS services are self‑managed unless critical issues arise. Support is provided via email, live chat, or tickets, and does not include game‑specific configurations unless expressly stated.

sections.title: Money‑Back Guarantee (Gameservers)
sections.content: A forty‑eight (48) hour money‑back guarantee is available only for gameservers (excluding VPS and dedicated servers).

sections.title: Cancellations and Refunds (Additional Terms)
list: Chargebacks without notice may result in immediate service suspension.
Refunds after 48 hours are issued as in‑store credit only if requested within seven (7) days of purchase.
Cancellations must be submitted properly through the billing area to avoid further charges.

sections.title: Uptime Guarantee
sections.content: We target 99.9% uptime. Detailed availability commitments and remedies are defined exclusively in the Service Level Agreement (SLA).

sections.title: Service Level Agreement and Credit Policy (Summary)
sections.content: The SLA applies to network, panel, and DDoS protection incidents subject to its stated conditions and exclusions. Clients may be eligible for service credits in accordance with the SLA. Where applicable and unless superseded by the SLA, credits may be requested by submitting a ticket within seven (7) days of the incident. The total amount of service credits for any month shall not exceed thirty percent (30%) of the monthly fee for the affected services.

sections.title: Affiliate Cashouts
sections.content: Affiliate payouts are processed within ten (10) to fifteen (15) business days via the selected payment method.

sections.title: Support Rules
sections.content: When opening a support ticket, you authorize Expanse to make necessary changes to resolve the issue unless you explicitly state otherwise.

sections.title: Tebex Checkout
sections.content: Purchases of certain digital content must be completed via Tebex Limited. You must agree to their applicable terms ("Tebex Terms").

sections.title: Billing and Auto‑Renewals
sections.content: Subscriptions auto‑renew unless cancelled before the next billing cycle. Customers are responsible for managing cancellations in the client area to avoid further charges.

sections.content: Except as required by law, services are provided "as is" and "as available" without warranties of any kind, whether express or implied, including but not limited to implied warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, or non‑infringement.
